prompt_init: You will receive a text. Your task is to rephrase this text without modifying its meaning. Just output your new text, nothing else. Here is the text:
prompt_update: You will receive a text. Your task is to rephrase this text without modifying its meaning. Just output your new text, nothing else. Here is the text:
initial_story:
Thanks for joining our live coverage on an extraordinary day in court, with adult-film star Stormy Daniels taking the stand.

It was a tense courtroom, with Daniels warned to dial back her comments at times. Prosecutors were also told to limit their questions regarding the salacious details of her alleged sexual encounter with Trump (which Trump has denied ever took place).

Here's our full wrap of what happened in court today.

This page was edited by Tiffany Wertheimer, Lisa Lambert, Brandon Livesay and Phil McCausland. The writers were Sam Hancock and Sean Seddon, and we had Madeline Halpert and Kayla Epstein in court.

Court doesn't sit on Wednesday, so we'll be back on Thursday, when Stormy Daniels will once again take to the stand to continue her testimony.
stories:
Thank you for tuning in to our live coverage of a remarkable day in court, during which adult film actress Stormy Daniels took the stand.

It was an uneasy atmosphere in the courtroom, with Ms. Daniels being cautioned to moderate her remarks on several occasions. Prosecutors were also instructed to limit their inquiries concerning the lewd particulars of her purported sexual liaison with Mr. Trump (which Mr. Trump has adamantly denied ever occurred).

Here is a comprehensive summary of what transpired in court today.

This page was edited by Tiffany Wertheimer, Lisa Lambert, Brandon Livesay, and Phil McCausland. The writers were Sam Hancock and Sean Seddon, and we had Madeline Halpert and Kayla Epstein present in court.

As the court is not in session on Wednesday, we will resume our coverage on Thursday, when Ms. Stormy Daniels will once again take the stand to continue her testimony.

The atmosphere in the courtroom was tense, as Ms. Daniels was repeatedly warned to watch her language, and prosecutors were instructed to limit their questioning about the alleged sexual encounter between Ms. Daniels and Mr. Trump (which Mr. Trump has strenuously denied ever took place).

Here is a summary of what transpired in court today.

This page was edited by Tiffany Wertheimer, Lisa Lambert, Brandon Livesay, and Phil McCausland. The writers were Sam Hancock and Sean Seddon, and we had Madeline Halpert and Kayla Epstein present in court.

As the court is not in session on Wednesday, we will continue our coverage on Thursday, when Ms. Stormy Daniels will return to the witness stand to give further testimony.
